<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/23/tiktok-faces-first-moderation-test-election-looming?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tok the Vote
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="TikTok on a phone with a vote sign next to it" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODkyL3Rpa3Rva19lbGVjdGlvbl92b3Rpbmdfc2lnbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With exactly 10 days until the presidential election, social media platforms have been working to get their content moderation ducks in a row. The new kid on the block, TikTok, is fighting a unique battle as it tries to <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/ebffedde-8432-41a3-94ae-72289ef82ba5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stay “apolitical”</a> in the lead-up to the election. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Is that even possible?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yes, and no. TikTok has <a href="https://mashable.com/article/tiktok-bans-political-ads/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">never</a> allowed political ads, and no major U.S. politician has a TikTok account (even if a dance battle might speed up stimulus talks). The platform has attempted to cultivate an apolitical reputation...mostly because it has to. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Despite the White House’s efforts, TikTok is still owned by Chinese tech company ByteDance, an arrangement that’s raised data privacy concerns. So it’s “fighting this public relations campaign that other social platforms haven’t had to in the same way,” Laura Garcia, a counter-disinformation journalist, told the Financial Times. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But like that one uncle at Thanksgiving</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">TikTok’s users just won’t stay out of politics. In June, TikTokers were <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/28/style/tiktok-teen-politics-gen-z.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">at the center</a> of a “mass false-registration drive” responsible for thousands of empty seats at a Trump rally in Tulsa, per the NYT. And videos with political hashtags like #Trump2020 and #Biden2020 have been attracting views faster than people can Google “what’s a D'amelio”: #Biden2020 had only 1.9 million views in February; now it has over 3.8 <em>billion</em>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">TikTok’s attempts to depoliticize itself while its users flood the platform with political content is an issue that its competitors have been dealing with <a href="https://www.pcmag.com/news/twitter-bans-political-ads-as-facebook-doubles-down?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">for years</a>. But TikTok has taken aggressive steps to root out harmful content, removing around 322,000 videos in the first half of the year for violating its policies against hate speech, and banning hashtags related to the QAnon conspiracy theory a month before Facebook took any action. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> TikTok is ~special~ when it comes to conversations around election integrity because of its connections to China, as well as its algorithm’s uncanny ability to create viral moments.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/23/international-news-roundup?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
From the International News Desk
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Nigeria protestors " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODkxL25pZ2VyaWFfcHJvdGVzdG9ycy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>PIUS UTOMI EKPEI/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Believe it or not, there is a world beyond the local Sonic. Let’s get an update from our international correspondent, Carlisle Sanfrancisco. Carlisle?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Israel: </strong>Yesterday,<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>Sudan became the third Arab country (after the UAE and Bahrain) to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-sudan-israel/israel-and-sudan-reach-u-s-brokered-deal-to-normalize-ties-idUSKBN278226?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">normalize diplomatic relations</a> with Israel this year. The historic agreement, which was brokered by the U.S., means the once-hostile countries will also begin to trade with one another. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Nigeria: </strong>Officials <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-23/curfew-eased-in-nigeria-s-biggest-city-after-protests-abate?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are lifting</a> a curfew in Lagos, Africa’s biggest city, after dozens were killed in <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-54666368?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">protests</a> against police brutality. The government has disbanded the particular police unit criticized by protesters, the Special Anti-Robbery Squad (called SARS), but unrest over inequality and corruption is lingering in this oil-rich nation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The EU: </strong>You won’t have to order “veggie discs” after the European Parliament <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/23/world/europe/eu-plant-based-labeling.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">struck down</a> a proposal that would’ve banned plant-based alternative meat products from using words like “burger” or “steak.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Slovakia: </strong>The government is trying to administer a coronavirus test to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/as-covid-sweeps-europe-one-country-tries-a-new-tactic-test-the-entire-population-11603462995?mod=hp_lead_pos10&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">every adult</a> over the next two weeks to tamp down a second wave of infections.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thailand: </strong>Apparently the mascots of Thai banks hold massive <a href="https://twitter.com/omuretto/status/1319499450046279682?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dance parties</a>. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/23/tesla-rolls-fullself-driving-beta-thats-not-full-selfdriving?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
"It May Do the Wrong Thing at the Worst Time"
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Tesla car going through manufacturing" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/UQnKf9uzu9oNJ8UEOJ/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Tesla car going through manufacturing" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/UQnKf9uzu9oNJ8UEOJ/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And with that vote of confidence, Tesla rolled out the beta version of its “Full Self-Driving” software to a small group of Tesla owners this week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What’s “full” self-driving? Emerging Tech Brew <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/10/23/tesla-releases-new-automated-driving-features-beta?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explains</a>: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More support for advanced driver assist on city streets </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Increased stop sign and traffic light perception capabilities</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A feature that can guide Tesla cars from highway on-ramps to off-ramps</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As you can see, this isn’t really full self-driving at all, which has earned the company <a href="https://news.yahoo.com/tesla-full-self-driving-vehicles-212544758.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">heaps of criticism</a> from experts who call the name dangerous, misleading, and potentially fraudulent. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even Elon “I’m sending 1 million people to Mars by 2050” Musk seems to be toning down the hype machine. On Tuesday, he tweeted that the rollout “Will be extremely slow & cautious, as it should.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>regulators said they’re keeping a close eye on how FSD unfolds, but Tesla is still slinging the tech. The price of “FSD beta” will <a href="https://news.yahoo.com/tesla-full-self-driving-vehicles-212544758.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rise</a> by $2,000 starting next Thursday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here: </strong>Tesla is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/23/tesla-recalls-model-s/x-cars-in-china-over-faulty-suspension.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recalling</a> nearly 50,000 Model S and X vehicles in China over potentially faulty front and rear suspensions. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STOCKS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/23/snapchat-crushed-earnings-keeps-cruising-upwards?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Oh, Snap
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Snap's stock chart showing its huge increase" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODkzL3NuYXBfc19hbGwtdGltZV9zdG9ja19jaGFydC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Google Finance</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Snap’s stock gained nearly 11% yesterday, capping off a <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/snapchat-q3-results-blew-wall-street-expectations-out-of-water-2020-10?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stellar week</a> for the social media platform most had written off as recently as two years ago. And it didn’t even need help from Fleetwood Mac or a skateboard. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>After getting the “<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/21/snap-netflix-post-solid-quarters?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pandemic bump</a>” in Q1 (when people began to hunker down inside), Snapchat came back to earth in Q2, adding far fewer users than the previous quarter. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Analysts expected the slump to continue into Q3, but Snap streaked in the opposite direction by adding 11 million daily active users—which matched its first-quarter haul.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And with ad revenue returning, Snap turned an <a href="https://www.fool.com/investing/2020/10/22/snap-defies-bears-stunning-growth-surprise-profit/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unexpected profit</a> and smashed earnings on Tuesday. As it continues to invest in augmented reality, which supports <a href="https://www.socialmediatoday.com/news/snapchat-launches-new-shoppable-ar-try-on-campaign-with-gucci-shoes/580762/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">virtual try-ons</a> and other cool features the youths love, advertisers may not disappear anytime soon. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Snap’s stock is now up a very Zoom-esque ~158% on the year. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">McFury: </strong>Use <a href="https://mcbroken.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this site</a> to<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>check if the ice cream machine is broken at your local McDonald’s <em>before</em> the cashier tells you they can’t make any M&M McFlurries today.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kids will do the darndest things, and sometimes those things make headlines. Three of these youth-centered news stories are real, while one we made up. Can you spot the little liar?</p>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Texas </span><span><a href="https://abc7ny.com/covid-19-cure-14-year-old-young-scientist-challenge-anika-chebrolu/7077464/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">14-year-old</a></span><span> wins $25,000 for developing potential COVID-19 treatment”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Teenager finally achieves her dream of </span><span><a href="https://kotaku.com/teenager-finally-achieves-her-dream-of-dating-godzilla-1845422085?utm_campaign=Kotaku&utm_content=1603196228&utm_medium=SocialMarketing&utm_source=twitter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dating Godzilla</a></span><span>” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Boy, 6, becomes Britain's </span><span><a href="https://sports.yahoo.com/youngest-author-ever-uk-160711054.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">youngest published author</a></span><span>”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“UberEats driver fined after his daughter secretly </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/YOYUUWgTkPP7FqasLj/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">took food</a></span><span> out of four orders he delivered” </span>
</li>
</ol>

New data showed U.S. business activity \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy/u-s-business-activity-picks-up-in-october-ihs-markit-idUSKBN2781WG?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epicking up\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in October, though.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCovid-19 update: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNew daily coronavirus cases are nearing a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/pandemics-virus-outbreak-connecticut-south-dakota-birthdays-dc26340a9b1311ad81e0f8b99a7a6dbd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecord high\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the U.S., with the seven-day moving average topping 61,140 on Thursday. That’s the most since Aug. 1. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSOCIAL MEDIA\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/23/tiktok-faces-first-moderation-test-election-looming?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTok the Vote\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"TikTok on a phone with a vote sign next to it\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODkyL3Rpa3Rva19lbGVjdGlvbl92b3Rpbmdfc2lnbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith exactly 10 days until the presidential election, social media platforms have been working to get their content moderation ducks in a row. The new kid on the block, TikTok, is fighting a unique battle as it tries to \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/ebffedde-8432-41a3-94ae-72289ef82ba5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estay “apolitical”\u003c/a\u003e in the lead-up to the election. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIs that even possible?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYes, and no. TikTok has \u003ca href=\"https://mashable.com/article/tiktok-bans-political-ads/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enever\u003c/a\u003e allowed political ads, and no major U.S. politician has a TikTok account (even if a dance battle might speed up stimulus talks). The platform has attempted to cultivate an apolitical reputation...mostly because it has to. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDespite the White House’s efforts, TikTok is still owned by Chinese tech company ByteDance, an arrangement that’s raised data privacy concerns. So it’s “fighting this public relations campaign that other social platforms haven’t had to in the same way,” Laura Garcia, a counter-disinformation journalist, told the Financial Times. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut like that one uncle at Thanksgiving\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTikTok’s users just won’t stay out of politics. In June, TikTokers were \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/28/style/tiktok-teen-politics-gen-z.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eat the center\u003c/a\u003e of a “mass false-registration drive” responsible for thousands of empty seats at a Trump rally in Tulsa, per the NYT. And videos with political hashtags like #Trump2020 and #Biden2020 have been attracting views faster than people can Google “what’s a D'amelio”: #Biden2020 had only 1.9 million views in February; now it has over 3.8 \u003cem\u003ebillion\u003c/em\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTikTok’s attempts to depoliticize itself while its users flood the platform with political content is an issue that its competitors have been dealing with \u003ca href=\"https://www.pcmag.com/news/twitter-bans-political-ads-as-facebook-doubles-down?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efor years\u003c/a\u003e. But TikTok has taken aggressive steps to root out harmful content, removing around 322,000 videos in the first half of the year for violating its policies against hate speech, and banning hashtags related to the QAnon conspiracy theory a month before Facebook took any action. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e TikTok is ~special~ when it comes to conversations around election integrity because of its connections to China, as well as its algorithm’s uncanny ability to create viral moments.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: Let’s get an update from our international correspondent, Carlisle Sanfrancisco. Carlisle?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIsrael: \u003c/strong\u003eYesterday,\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eSudan became the third Arab country (after the UAE and Bahrain) to \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-sudan-israel/israel-and-sudan-reach-u-s-brokered-deal-to-normalize-ties-idUSKBN278226?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enormalize diplomatic relations\u003c/a\u003e with Israel this year. The historic agreement, which was brokered by the U.S., means the once-hostile countries will also begin to trade with one another. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNigeria: \u003c/strong\u003eOfficials \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-23/curfew-eased-in-nigeria-s-biggest-city-after-protests-abate?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare lifting\u003c/a\u003e a curfew in Lagos, Africa’s biggest city, after dozens were killed in \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-54666368?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprotests\u003c/a\u003e against police brutality. The government has disbanded the particular police unit criticized by protesters, the Special Anti-Robbery Squad (called SARS), but unrest over inequality and corruption is lingering in this oil-rich nation.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe EU: \u003c/strong\u003eYou won’t have to order “veggie discs” after the European Parliament \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/23/world/europe/eu-plant-based-labeling.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estruck down\u003c/a\u003e a proposal that would’ve banned plant-based alternative meat products from using words like “burger” or “steak.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSlovakia: \u003c/strong\u003eThe And it didn’t even need help from Fleetwood Mac or a skateboard. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter getting the “\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/21/snap-netflix-post-solid-quarters?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epandemic bump\u003c/a\u003e” in Q1 (when people began to hunker down inside), Snapchat came back to earth in Q2, adding far fewer users than the previous quarter. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnalysts expected the slump to continue into Q3, but Snap streaked in the opposite direction by adding 11 million daily active users—which matched its first-quarter haul.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd with ad revenue returning, Snap turned an \u003ca href=\"https://www.fool.com/investing/2020/10/22/snap-defies-bears-stunning-growth-surprise-profit/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunexpected profit\u003c/a\u003e and smashed earnings on Tuesday. As it continues to invest in augmented reality, which supports \u003ca href=\"https://www.socialmediatoday.com/news/snapchat-launches-new-shoppable-ar-try-on-campaign-with-gucci-shoes/580762/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evirtual try-ons\u003c/a\u003e and other cool features the youths love, advertisers may not disappear anytime soon. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eSnap’s stock is now up a very
